Hey Joe, have you heard about Karl Lewin's project?  I believe he is 
also on this list.  He also implemented NEAT in python.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Joseph Reisinger <joeraii@c...> wrote:
> I was inspired during the GECCO conference to get to work on my 
next set
> of experiments, and luckily I had some time over the holiday 
weekend, so I
> cranked out a general version of NEAT written in Python. "General" 
means
> that it just has the elements of complexifying evolution and 
speciation,
> and is pretty much domain-agnostic.
> 
> I've designed the system to be as extensible and user-friendly as 
possible
> (based on my experience with the last implementation of NEAT I 
wrote :),
> since I'd like to use it for several different experiments with and
> without neural networks.
> 
> Anyway if anyone is interested, just drop me a line. So far the 
basic
> system is complete, but I'm missing a lot of the nicer data vis and
> recording features. Hopefully the system is extensible enough that 
I can
> easily leverage some of the XML vis work going on here.
> 
> Joe
> 
> -- 
> 
> Joseph Reisinger
> http://www.cs.utexas.edu/users/joeraii
